column2: Original sentence: Mary knows Jacob.\nIn the given sentence, the subject-object-verb order is used, which means that "Mary" is the subject, "Jacob" is the object, and "knows" is the verb. To reconstruct the sentence in the standard subject-verb-object order, we simply need to switch the positions of "Mary" and "Jacob" to get "Mary knows Jacob."

column2: Original sentence: Mary knows Jacob.\nIn the given sentence, the subject-object-verb order is used, which means that "Mary" is the subject, "Jacob" is the object, and "knows" is the verb. To reconstruct the sentence in the standard subject-verb-object order, we simply need to switch the positions of "Mary" and "Jacob" to get "Mary knows Jacob."
